summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2016 (NA) LARK VT714TA (NA) TRAILER EQUIPPED WITH TREDIT TIRE AND WHEEL COMPANY TIRES H188ST TIRES, SIZE: 205/175D15. WHILE DRIVING VARIOUS SPEEDS, THE REAR AXLE SEPARATED FROM THE BODY OF THE TRAILER. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A CERTIFIED MECHANIC WHO DETERMINED THAT THE SEPARATION OF THE AXLE CAUSED PREMATURE WEAR ON ALL FOUR TIRES OF THE VEHICLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE VIN WAS INVALID. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN.

TIRE FOLDED DUE TO AXLE BRAKE. TRAILER STARTED GOING FROM SIDE TO SIDE. SLAMMING INTO SNOWBANKS. ALMOST TOOK US OFF MOUNTAIN. TECH SAID AXLES WERE BAD BUT BECAUSE TOW TRUCK DRIVER AND THE SLAMMING INTO SNOWBANKS LARK WILL NOT WARRANTY. READ SEVERAL REVIEWS THAT STATE PEOPLE HAVING SAME TROUBLE WITH LIPPERT AXLES.  *TR
